questions.question_text:
The Salesforce team at Cloud Kicks (CK) is reviewing the sales team s business processes. During a review session, the business analyst notices that quantifiable benchmarks have yet to be established.
Why is it a best practice to establish benchmarks to evaluate existing processes?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
By establishing a baseline and tracking progress against that baseline, it becomes possible to see the tangible impact that changes to processes have on the business

choices.B: Proves processes are out of date and require a new solution
choices.C: Compares processes against CK's closest competitors
choices.A: Shows tangible impact from changes to processes

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Updating the change request log is essential for documenting the requested changes, tracking them, and ensuring they are properly managed throughout the project. Additionally, drafting a new user story is a way to capture the updated requirements in a clear and concise format that can be easily understood by the development team. User stories are a common Agile technique for capturing functional requirements and are used as a basis for development and testing.

"A" might be relevant for managing the changes, but it doesn't specifically address how to capture the updated requirements in a user-focused format like a user story.

"C" is not directly related to managing changes to requirements after the technical demo.

Selected Answer: B
The important part is creating a 'User Story' for the new changes/updates, none of the other answers specify that happening. This is important before you get to the testing stage as what are you testing if you haven't created a story for the change/update

I think correct option is A.
When requirements change, it is important to update the change management document and user acceptance testing plans. This will ensure that all stakeholders are aware of the changes and that the new requirements are tested thoroughly.

choices.B: Update the change request log and draft a new user story.
choices.C: Update the gap analysis document and scope statement specification.
choices.A: Update the change management document and user acceptance testing plans.

questions.question_text:
The business analyst (BA) at Universal Containers is preparing for user acceptance testing (UAT) for an Experience Cloud implementation.
Which people should participate in UAT?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The question asks who should attend & 2 of the answers specify yourself (and you SHOULD be attending) so C is out as it doesn't include you the BA

The project manager may not be the one using the updates that are being tested where else the Business Users will be so B is out

This leaves only A as the correct option

Selected Answer: A
Project Manager is an optional attendee in the UAT

Selected Answer: B
PM is required also key stakeholders and BA

C or B
Coz BA is preparing for the test and you need PM and stakeholders to be part of it

comments.content: User has to be part of UAT. Option B does not include user. Hence option A is correct.

choices.B: Ask the stakeholder to demo their solution to the project team.
choices.C: Implement the solution now to save time in the planning phase.
choices.A: Gather requirements and then note the proposed solution.

discussion.content: BA should gather all the requirements and also note down the solution proposed by stakeholder. Hence option A is correct.
